dialogues.text: Why? (beat) How?? Elisa makes a gesture- indicating the peculiar anatomy details.

dialogues.speaker: ZELDA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Does he? Have a-? (beat) Lord! Never trust a man. Pfft- Even if he looks flat down there... Suddenly 3 MP’s are standing in front of them. With ther

dialogues.speaker: FLEMING
dialogues.text: Zelda, Elisa: Come with me.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: INT. STRICKLAND’S OFFICE - NIGHT 171 Yolanda and Duane are leaving. Zelda and Elisa enter. Strickland is tired. He looks it. This is clearly routine rubs his eyes and almost yawns as he speaks-  87

dialogues.speaker: STRICKLAND
dialogues.text: If you know something about what transpired here last Wednesday night, if you saw anything out of the ordinary, it is your obligation to report it. Under the desk, he removes his shoes- stretches his legs. STRICKLAND (CONT’D) Any detail- no matter how small or trivial it seems... Zeldelilah (beat) Trivial means unimportant.

dialogues.speaker: ZELDA
dialogues.text: I didn’t see nothing out of the ordinary, no- Or trivial. My feet were hurting too much-

dialogues.speaker: STRICKLAND
dialogues.text: (to Elisa) What about you? Elisa signs.

dialogues.speaker: ZELDA
dialogues.text: Neither did she.

dialogues.speaker: STRICKLAND
dialogues.text: (sotto) Hoffstetler- Dr. Hoffstetler- did either of you see him coming in or out of the lab?

dialogues.speaker: ZELDA
dialogues.text: Well, he works there- doesn’t he?

dialogues.speaker: STRICKLAND
dialogues.text: I mean in a different way- doing something different- Elisa signs.

dialogues.speaker: ZELDA
dialogues.text: (translates) Something trivial? No, Sir- Mmhno-

dialogues.speaker: STRICKLAND
dialogues.text: I want you to think. People get loose, people pay the price. He looks at Elisa who stares back at him. Her imperturbability mocks him.

dialogues.speaker: STRICKLAND, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (to himself) What am I doing? Guffaws. Beat.

dialogues.speaker: STRICKLAND, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Interviewing the fucking help- the shit cleaners, the piss wipers- You two- Just go. Leave. Elisa fumes quietly and then signs violently.

dialogues.speaker: STRICKLAND, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: What did she say? (straight at Elisa) What did you say? What did she say? She is clearly saying “Fuck you.”

dialogues.speaker: ZELDA
dialogues.text: I didn’t catch it. I wasn’t looking. Elisa nudges Zelda and signs again- even angrier.

dialogues.speaker: ZELDA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: She said “Thank you.” Elisa looks at Zelda angrily- goes for the pen and paper. Zelda gets her up and out. ZELDA (CONT’D) Thank you, sir-

dialogues.speaker: STRICKLAND
dialogues.text: You know, Elisa? For a mute, you talk too much. String Quartet No.1, 0p.18 No.1 (Beethoven, Ludwig van) Adagio affetuoso pre-laps. INT. HOFFSTETLER’S APARTMENT - DAY 171A A baquelite RADIO is playing the piece. Hoffstetler is ironing his pants’ crease with mathematical precision. Doorbell rings. Opens the door. BURLY RUSSIAN and MIHALKO stand there.

dialogues.speaker: HOFFSTETLER
dialogues.text: Comrades. Please, come in. TIME CUT: Hoffstetler pours some hot tea.  89

dialogues.speaker: MIHALKOV
dialogues.text: Your extraction papers... will be ready soon.

dialogues.speaker: HOFFSTETLER
dialogues.text: I am very grateful... Stupid as the American are- it won't be long for them to find me.

dialogues.speaker: MIHALKOV
dialogues.text: Nothing to worry about. They come in, discreetly examine everything, open drawers

dialogues.speaker: MIHALKOV, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: But I have a question, then- A personal question. I am a little curious. Hoffstetler spots the gun in Mihalkov’s waist.

dialogues.speaker: HOFFSTETLER
dialogues.text: Yes? Go ahead. Would you like some butter cake?

dialogues.speaker: BURLY RUSSIAN
dialogues.text: Yes. Please. Hoffstetler goes to the kitchen slices a home baked cake. Discreetly pockets the knife.

dialogues.speaker: MIHALKOV
dialogues.text: The asset... when you injected it, how did it react? Hoffstetler serves the cake.

dialogues.speaker: HOFFSTETLER
dialogues.text: How did it--

dialogues.speaker: MIHALKOV
dialogues.text: React. See? In humans the poison works instantaneously while for animals there is a delayed reaction. I was curious...

dialogues.speaker: HOFFSTETLER
dialogues.text: It was instant.

dialogues.speaker: BURLY RUSSIAN
dialogues.text: This is very good cake. You made it? Hoffstetler nods.  90

dialogues.speaker: BURLY RUSSIAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You are very good at this-

dialogues.speaker: MIHALKOV
dialogues.text: What did you do with the corpus? Hoffstetler readies the knife.

dialogues.speaker: HOFFSTETLER
dialogues.text: I performed an autopsy. Unenlightening. As Lenin said, there is no profit in last week's fish.

dialogues.speaker: MIHALKOV
dialogues.text: Lenin said that?

dialogues.speaker: HOFFSTETLER
dialogues.text: Um. Of course. MIHALKOV gets up. Puts his hat on. Goes to the door.

dialogues.speaker: MIHALKOV
dialogues.text: Perhaps. Perhaps you're misremembering. Wait for our call. Shouldn’t be much longer. Canned laughter pre-laps-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The family watches Dobie Gillis.

dialogues.speaker: ELAINE,
dialogues.text: That's a gelatine parfait. (beat) Parfait- it’s a French word. Means “perfect” You like it? ‘TIMMY Dad- Dad- can we watch Bonanza?

dialogues.speaker: ELAINE
dialogues.text: Bonanza is much too violent. (back to Strickland) It has little pieces of celery and walnut. Recipe’s right out of the box- real convenient. They say it’s the future of home cooking.

dialogues.speaker: STRICKLAND
dialogues.text: Bonanza is not violent. It’s real life. The way it was. (MORE)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The way it is. A man faces a problem. It’s up to him to solve it.

dialogues.speaker: ELAINE,
dialogues.text: You know what I was thinking today? We get settled maybe we could get the kids a p-u-p-p-y. TAMMY, playing with her Barbies- snaps- ‘TAMMY We can spell, Mom.

dialogues.speaker: ELAINE,
dialogues.text: We can go to the park- Do something together? STRICKLAND changes channels; The NEWS. Martin Luther talks to a massive crowd.

dialogues.speaker: STRICKLAND
dialogues.text: Puppy becomes a dog. Dog’s a wild animal We never “domesticated” the damn things--

dialogues.speaker: ELAINE
dialogues.text: Language, Richard. Little pitchers have big ears... 91 King Strickland changes channels: Vietnam- Carson- Phone start ringing.

dialogues.speaker: STRICKLAND
dialogues.text: They never learn their place. Rover, Lassie, Spot... They’re carnivores. We never strip them of their nature... They'll eat your hand as soon as they'll take a shit in your yard.

dialogues.speaker: ELAINE
dialogues.text: Richard! Phone rings. Strickland disconnects the phone-

dialogues.speaker: STRICKLAND
dialogues.text: Don’t reconnect it. Don’t answer it. - walks away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It’s raining like hell. Strickland exits the house drink hand- enters the car. Takes a cigarette, lights it. He uncovers his fingers: they are black. He presses one- squirts a yellow liquid. And thinks. cur TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The tub’s filling up. The creature watches. She opens and closes the HOT/COLD faucet. Tests the water She takes the box of algae that Hoffstetler gave her. She opens the box. She gets an idea. Smiles and looks around bathroom. -opens the faucet on the sink. The sink overflows She takes the towels- sealing the cracks- and uses a towe stuff the space between the door and the floor. The water continues to run—

dialogues.speaker: CAMERA GOES BELOW 174
dialogues.text: -Into the theatre- Water pours from above and onto the empty seats and- -onto the scattered customers’ faces. They get up from their seats.

dialogues.speaker: CUT BACK
dialogues.text: Elisa is floating, naked, next to the Amphibian Man- now entire BATHROOM is immersed in water. She embraces him- Eyes closed, feeling him underneath her the water on her face. His markings move rhythmically lik melody. She intakes and holds.  175 176 93 As the water goes above her head. They float underwater. Contemplating each other. cur TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Giles gets up. He absentmindedly puts on his robe- folds his MURPHY BED and heads to his drawing table. On it: the large format sketch of the Amphibian Man (which is lookin beautiful) Giles takes Iodine and cotton and removes the bandage from his arm: the wounds are gone. He catches his reflection on his reference mirror- and is startled to discover-

dialogues.speaker: SHOCK
dialogues.text: -His head has hair. A lot of it. It’s growing from his scalp... And his beard is darker, his skin tighter. He pu his hair- It’s his. Looks down inside his pajama trousers.

dialogues.speaker: GILES
dialogues.text: Well, Oh, well- Hello! He hurries-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Across the hall.

dialogues.speaker: MR. ARZOUMANIAN
dialogues.text: What is going on? I’ve got water pouring into the bible movie. I have four paying customers. I can’t afford a refund.

dialogues.speaker: GILES
dialogues.text: It's a pipe. It’s a pipe. I’1l take care of it. I/11 fix it.

dialogues.speaker: MR. ARZOUMANIAN
dialogues.text: I can’t have water pouring into the goddamn bible movie.

dialogues.speaker: GILES
dialogues.text: Alright. I/1l take care of it. Elisa! Elisa!  177 178 179 94 INT. ELISA’S APARTMENT - SAME 177 Water spills from the bathroom door. Giles treads careful

dialogues.speaker: GILES
dialogues.text: Oh, God- Elisa? Knocks on the bathroom door. Water projecting from its en contour. Noises. The door opens. Water pours out. Inside the Amphibian Man and Elisa, naked, covering herse with the plastic curtain. Giles, soaked, laughs. In the soundtrack: Trixie Smith sings MY UNUSUAL MAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Giles towels his hair.

dialogues.speaker: GILES
dialogues.text: I’m toweling my hair, Elisa. My hair. And- and- look at the arm: healed. As if nothing had happened... You said he was a god. I don’t know. He ate a cat... (beat) You know what this means? We have to keep him around- just a little bit longer. You don’t want to lose him, do you? (beat) We cannot just- let him go- like that- We gotta keep him. cur TO: INT. COMMAND CENTER / STRICKLAND’S OFFICE - DAY 179 Hoffstetler meets Strickland.

dialogues.speaker: HOFFSTETLER
dialogues.text: You wanted to see me?

dialogues.speaker: STRICKLAND
dialogues.text: Transcribe it, Sally.

dialogues.speaker: SALLY
dialogues.text: Right away, Sir.  95

dialogues.speaker: STRICKLAND
dialogues.text: Come on up- I have a few questions for you.

dialogues.speaker: HOFFSTETLER
dialogues.text: Of course. Strickland climbs the steps to his office.

dialogues.speaker: HOFFSTETLER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Thank you. Strickland gives him some water.

dialogues.speaker: STRICKLAND
dialogues.text: Have a seat. They sit.

dialogues.speaker: HOFFSTETLER
dialogues.text: How's it going? The investigation.

dialogues.speaker: STRICKLAND
dialogues.text: Well- we have a promising lead.

dialogues.speaker: HOFFSTETLER
dialogues.text: Really? That’s good to hear. They sit.

dialogues.speaker: STRICKLAND
dialogues.text: You joined us in Galveston. But where were you before, Hoffstetler? Where did you come to us from

dialogues.speaker: HOFFSTETLER
dialogues.text: Doctor.

dialogues.speaker: STRICKLAND
dialogues.text: Excuse me?

dialogues.speaker: HOFFSTETLER
dialogues.text: Doctor Hoffstetler. Protocol. (beat) Wisconsin. Madison.

dialogues.speaker: STRICKLAND
dialogues.text: That's right- You gave up a tenure track position. Didn’t ya? Gave it all up for us.

dialogues.speaker: HOFFSTETLER
dialogues.text: I did.

dialogues.speaker: STRICKLAND
dialogues.text: I suppose you're getting ready to leave us now, then- Hoffstetler drinks.

dialogues.speaker: HOFFSTETLER
dialogues.text: only if the creature isn’t found.

dialogues.speaker: STRICKLAND
dialogues.text: What do you think? You think we will-? Find it?

dialogues.speaker: HOFFSTETLER
dialogues.text: Well, you said you had a lead. Long beat.

dialogues.speaker: STRICKLAND
dialogues.text: I do. A HANDFUL OF STARS by Jon Eric Kellso starts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Giles paints a portrait of Elisa and the Amphibian Man. It rains outside. Camera dollies across his window and discovers- INT. ELISA’S APARTMENT - DAWN 179A The creature eyes the rain - almost pained- like a doggie wants out. She watches him touch the glass. She touches his shoulder Scales come off in her hand.

dialogues.speaker: OMITTED 179B
dialogues.text: OMITTED 179¢

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Elisa walks the canals- Rain. The waters are rising, churning. Growing.

dialogues.speaker: 182A
dialogues.text: 97 Near the 30ft mark.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Raining. HOFFSTETLER, lugging two empty suitcases into hi building. Watching from across the street: FLEMING IN HIS CAR. INT. HOFFSTETLER’S APARTMENT - DAY 181 Hoffstetler enters his apartment. Telephone is ringing.

dialogues.speaker: HOFFSTETLER
dialogues.text: Hello? He looks around- tense. Out the window. MIHALKOV’S VOICE Extraction is ready. Same place, Forty-eight hours.

dialogues.speaker: HOFFSTETLER
dialogues.text: Forty eight hours??? They hang up. Hoffstetler looks out the window. EXT. HOFFSTETLER’S APARTMENT - SAME 181A POV HOFF: A car, lights on: Fleming, eating a sandwich an listening to “Norman” by Sue Thompson

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sally awaits for Strickland.

dialogues.speaker: SALLY
dialogues.text: Sir, General Hoyt.  98

dialogues.speaker: STRICKLAND
dialogues.text: Tell him I’m not in, tell him 1 will call him back. Don’t put him through-

dialogues.speaker: SALLY
dialogues.text: No, Sir- he’s in your office. Strickland looks up: Hoyt drinks coffee by the window. Lo directly at him.

dialogues.speaker: STRICKLAND, (PRELAP)
dialogues.text: I believe I have identified the mole. I will confirm and act on it. 183 INT. STRICKLAND’S OFFICE - DAY 183

dialogues.speaker: GENERAL HOYT
dialogues.text: At this point our only concern is the asset. Do you have it?

dialogues.speaker: STRICKLAND
dialogues.text: Still in the wind, sir-

dialogues.speaker: GENERAL HOYT
dialogues.text: That won’t do. You'll have to fix it.

dialogues.speaker: STRICKLAND
dialogues.text: Yes, Sir. T know. But- May I ask one question, Sir?

dialogues.speaker: GENERAL HOYT
dialogues.text: This wouldn't be the appropriate time, I don’t think. Strickland finds a loose thread- sticking out from his ja lapel. Tucks at it- hides it- folds it.

dialogues.speaker: STRICKLAND
dialogues.text: I need to ask, Sir- respectfully.

dialogues.speaker: GENERAL HOYT
dialogues.text: Then go ahead, Son.

dialogues.speaker: STRICKLAND
dialogues.text: You've know me for- how long?

dialogues.speaker: GENERAL HOYT
dialogues.text: Thirteen years. Battle of Pusan.

dialogues.speaker: STRICKLAND
dialogues.text: Yes, Sir- and in all that time, I, I've never once- (beat) This is- what happened here is- A man is faithful, Sir- loyal, efficient all of his life. All of it- and he is- useful. And he expects- He has certain expectations in return. And he fails, then- once. Only once. What does that make him? Does that make him a failure? (beat) When is a man done? Proving himself, Sir? A good man. A decent man-

dialogues.speaker: GENERAL HOYT
dialogues.text: Decent? (beat: yes) Aman has the decency not to fuck up- that’s one thing. That is real decent of him. The other kind of decency-? It doesn’t really matter. We sell it- Sure- But it’s an export. And we sell it ‘cause we don't use it. (beat) See? Thirty six hours from now- this entire episode will be over. And so will you... (beat) Our universe will have a hole in it with your outline. And you will have gone on to an alternate universe. A universe of shit. You will be lost to civilization. You will be unborn. Unmade. Undone. (beat) So- go get some real decency, Son. And unfuck this mess.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BAMM!! The door opens. Strickland enters. Almost entirely of breath- suffocating- gasping. Panicked. He tries to calm down. Wets his face- lets the water run. Liquid oozes from his hand. He pulls at the thread and pu at it- -and it unravels his lapel. He gets angry and removes his jacket violently and throws it down on the floor. Then he looks deep in the mirror. Deep eye contact with himself.

dialogues.speaker: STRICKLAND
dialogues.text: Thirty-six hours. Deliver. You deliver. That’s what you do. You deliver. You don’t fail- A fly lands on his hand, rubs its legs. cur To:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Giles- all energy- paints a large canvas image of the amphibian man. Elisa goes by. She enters her apartment without saying a single word.

dialogues.speaker: OMITTED 187
dialogues.text: INT. KITCHEN, ELISA’S APARTMENT - NIGHT 188

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Elisa rips off a leaf in her calenda: reads: RAIN. DOCKS. The leaf exposed now She looks at window, Pelted by rain. Buckets and pails on her floor pick up water from ceiling leaks. The Creature stands under one particularly big leak in th kitchen. Later: Elisa peels eggs for the Amphibian Man. He looks g weak. Barely eats.  189 101 He looks at her- Suddenly, she whistles softly, then sign and then, finally, sings- quietly at first:

dialogues.speaker: ELISA
dialogues.text: You'll never know just how much I've loved you... You'll never know just how much I care... AMPHIBIAN MAN doesn’t react, she puts down her spoon and continues- with her impossibly sweet voice:

dialogues.speaker: ELISA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: And if I tried, I still couldn't hide my love for you... You ought to know, for haven't I told you so... A million or more times

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She gets up and sings to him- The Walls of the kitchen va and she stands, dressed in a sequined gown, surrounded by musical stage.

dialogues.speaker: ELISA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You went away and my heart went with you I speak your name in my every prayer... AMPHIBIAN MAN gets up, suddenly sparkling, dreamy and attentive. He moves close to her and gently takes her in arms.

dialogues.speaker: ELISA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: If there is some other way to prove That I love you, I swear I don't know how... They move close to each other and dance gently, in harmon

dialogues.speaker: ELISA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You'll never know if you don't know now... At the end of the song / choreography, everything goes ba to normal. They eat in silence. The creature wheezes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Zelda changes her shoes- and is about to step out when sh spots: Elisa, crying her eyes out. They look at each othe

dialogues.speaker: ZELDA,
dialogues.text: Elisa. What is it, honey? INT. ELISA’S BATHROOM - NIGHT 190 In the tub, the Fish Man wheezes as if he were on dry lan

dialogues.speaker: ZELDA
dialogues.text: Oh- No, Honey, no- He doesn’t look too good. (beat) This is bad. I’m going to call Hoffstetler... Elisa pours water onto him but it doesn’t help. Helpless, looks out the window at the RAIN beginning to come down outside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Reading Hoffstetler’s card, Zelda dials the public phone. INT. HOFFSTETLER’S APARTMENT - NIGHT 191 Raining. Hoffstetler closes his bags. Leaves. Closes the door. The phone rings. And rings- and rings-

dialogues.speaker: THE AMPHIBIAN MAN
dialogues.text: Is WEAK. Giles, Zelda and Elisa help him stand under the rain. SOAKING. HIS GILLS AND FINS extend. Gills open. It breathes!!

dialogues.speaker: ZELDA
dialogues.text: When I was a little girl- I found a turtle sitting out in the middle of the road. Crossing it slowly. Car could run it over any minute. (MORE)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 1gic 103

dialogues.speaker: ZELDA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: So, I picked it up, took it toa pond way back behind my house... and I laid it down under a big camphor tree, and I thought... “Mmmh- It's gonna be so happy here”. And I left it there. (beat) But that night I figured out I had no idea where it was going... Far as I know it was bringing food to its nest or- looking to porcreate- or escaping an owl. And maybe the worst place to keep it- maybe the place it was running from was that pond under that camphor tree. (looks at the fish) I didn’t care. I just did what I wanted with it... Giles Hugs Elisa:

dialogues.speaker: GILES
dialogues.text: You love him, Honey- We know what to do... Let him go... She nods. INT. ELISA’S APARTMENT - NIGHT 191BA Giles leaves Elisa at her doorstep. She spots the creatur the kitchen window. Standing under a water leak. Weak. Elisa and the Amphibian Man head for the bathroom but pau INT. ELISA’S APARTMENT - NIGHT 191c She guides him to her bed. They lie down. She embraces him. He embraces her back. She leans on his chest. Closing her eyes. She hears his heart. ‘Thump-thump-thump-thump- it becomes the rhythm of waves, murmur of the sea. She looks up- -at the ceiling, that suddenly becomes a deep, dark ocean  192 104 She raises her hand: Webbing seems to extend from her thu to her index. She closes her eyes and smiles. cur TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sitting in Fleming’s car- Strickland spies through a pair binoculars. He looks ill- sweaty.

dialogues.speaker: FLEMING
dialogues.text: Sir- If you don’t mind me saying so: You don’t look too well.

dialogues.speaker: STRICKLAND
dialogues.text: Shut up... Fleming lowers the window- there is a smell he can’t pinpoint. FLIES walk around Strickland’s hand.

dialogues.speaker: FLEMING
dialogues.text: Sir- do you smell that? I- I think is it your fingers... They're black, Sir- Strickland snatches the binoculars.

dialogues.speaker: STRICKLAND
dialogues.text: There he is- Doctor fucking shit- bird.

dialogues.speaker: FLEMING
dialogues.text: There’s no call for cursing, Sir- Hoffstetler exits his building, opens his umbrella- carry the leather suitcases and a baquelite radio into the rain

dialogues.speaker: STRICKLAND
dialogues.text: Get out of the car. I’m taking it.

dialogues.speaker: FLEMING
dialogues.text: My car? Strickland eats hard candy- mixing it with pain pills.

dialogues.speaker: STRICKLAND
dialogues.text: Get the fuck out.

dialogues.speaker: FLEMING
dialogues.text: Out of my car?

dialogues.speaker: STRICKLAND
dialogues.text: Did I stutter?  105

dialogues.speaker: FLEMING
dialogues.text: No. Not doing it.

dialogues.speaker: STRICKLAND
dialogues.text: Come again?

dialogues.speaker: FLEMING
dialogues.text: No- no- That’s it, see? You are- a very imposing man but- (beat) We must file- file this. Get clearance. Call it up- I’ve been doing surveillance. Unauthorized surveillance for you- I’m not clocking extra time I- Rain falls outside.

dialogues.speaker: FLEMING, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: But I draw the line here. Enough is enough is enough. We go back. File the forms and let central know what you're doing. We get an administrative package and allocate resources. Then- but not until then- you can take my car or any car you need. Strickland shoots him in the face. Twice.

dialogues.speaker: STRICKLAND
dialogues.text: You never shut up. (beat) Silence. I just want silence. 193-194 omrrrED 193-194 195

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hoffstetler smokes under an umbrella. The car pulls up. This time it stops further away. Rain backlit by its headlights. BURLY RUSSIAN climbs out. Stands in silence. the rain. Hoffstetler fidgets. Turns on a flashlight- Slowly gets u takes a couple of steps. Stops. Evaluates the immobility the Burly Russian.  196 197 106

dialogues.speaker: HOFFSTETLER
dialogues.text: It’s raining like hell, isn’t it-? He-he- No password today? Burly Russian raises his hand- in it: a gun. He fires twi One bullet goes clean through Hoffstetler’s gut- He pulls out his gun- A bullet goes through his cheek!! Cigarette EMBERS floati in the air! Pulls out his gun and crawls/slips backwards the mud. Looks for his glasses- One of them shattered.

dialogues.speaker: HOFFSTETLER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: No-no- comrade- no- please- The BURLY RUSSIAN comes to finish the job- raises his gun -BAMM! A quarter of flesh & bone flies away from his head The DRIVER comes out and pulls out a gun, two shots down Hoffstetler turns to see- STRICKLAND walking rapidly towards him.

dialogues.speaker: HOFFSTETLER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Strickland, thank God! He goes for his gun. Strickland stops him.

dialogues.speaker: STRICKLAND
dialogues.text: You were speaking Russian, Bob. Strickland hooks/yanks Hoffstetler around by the hole in cheek. Takes him under a -

dialogues.speaker: HOFFSTETLER
dialogues.text: Augggh- What are you doing? I need to go to a hospital. I’m bleeding- His flashlight illuminates Strickland’s glazed eyes.

dialogues.speaker: STRICKLAND
dialogues.text: What's your name? Your real name.  107 He drops him on the ground. The clouds in the overcast sk rumble with thunder.

dialogues.speaker: HOFFSTETLER
dialogues.text: Strickland- you know me- I’m Robert Hoffstetler- Strickland kicks him on the wounded area. Hoffstetler gru

dialogues.speaker: STRICKLAND
dialogues.text: Don't lie. You don’t need to. Bullet went through your gut. Shit is mixing with your blood right now- poisoning it. Blood and shit. Can you imagine? You're dead.

dialogues.speaker: HOFFSTETLER
dialogues.text: They’11 find me.

dialogues.speaker: STRICKLAND
dialogues.text: Who? The same people that tried to kill you just now? Come on “Bob” You work for a government... you know they don’t give a fuck about you or me- He puts his finger INSIDE Hoffstetlers’ cheek injury and hooks him aggressively. Hoffstetler screams in pain. Excrement and blood spurt out of his wound.

dialogues.speaker: HOFFSTETLER
dialogues.text: Augh- no- Please- listen to me.

dialogues.speaker: STRICKLAND
dialogues.text: I’m gonna need the names, ranks and location of the entire strike team.

dialogues.speaker: HOFFSTETLER
dialogues.text: Strike team?

dialogues.speaker: STRICKLAND
dialogues.text: The ones that took the asset. Zap. Kick. Kick. Zap. Hard candy.

dialogues.speaker: STRICKLAND, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: This candy. It’s cheap candy. I love it since I was a kid. Some favor more sophisticated snacks- Nougat center and all that fu-fu shit. But not me, Bob. This is it for me. (beat) (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: STRICKLAND, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Sometimes, if Im feeling anxious, I just bite right into it- chew it to Pieces. But- (Kick, kick) -most of the time- I just take my time. I make it last. Strickland shocks Hoffstetler with the Alabama Howdy-Do.

dialogues.speaker: STRICKLAND, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Names, ranks and location of the entire strike team. Hoffstetler laughs weakly. Gets shocked again. STRICKLAND (CONT’D) Names! Ranks! Now!

dialogues.speaker: HOFFSTETLER
dialogues.text: (weak laughter) No names, no ranks, they... (beat) They just clean... Strickland comes to an impossible conclusion:

dialogues.speaker: STRICKLAND
dialogues.text: Piss Wipers... Shit cleaners

dialogues.speaker: HOFFSTETLER
dialogues.text: (quietly, In Russian) I'm not one of those who left their land... To the mercy of the enemy. I was deaf to their gross flattery. I won't grant them my songs

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Strickland cattleprods Hoffstetler for too long. His woun and mouth emit a bit of smoke cur TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PORCELAIN SPARROWS IN FLIGHT adorn the walls. A lovingly- decorated, humble home. Zelda is frying some Brussels sprouts with bacon. Knock Knock.  109

dialogues.speaker: ZELDA
dialogues.text: Alright Brewster. I’m gonna fix you dinner and then I’m going to run out for a little while and help a friend. Her husband BREWSTER sits in his Barca-lounger. We get th feeling Brewster does a lot of sitting.

dialogues.speaker: BREWSTER
dialogues.text: Help with what?

dialogues.speaker: ZELDA
dialogues.text: Helping a friend.

dialogues.speaker: BREWSTER
dialogues.text: Zelda. Door. She Lowers the burner and comes to the door.

dialogues.speaker: ZELDA
dialogues.text: Well- You could well help me answer the door, Brewster! You're laying there- not ten feet away.

dialogues.speaker: BREWSTER
dialogues.text: My back is acting up, woman. Opens it.

dialogues.speaker: ZELDA
dialogues.text: Your back. Your back. Always your back. (surprised) Mr. Strickland, what-- Strickland barges past her into her house. Pops a handful pills.

dialogues.speaker: ZELDA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: What are you doing here--?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Strickland and Brewster size each other up.

dialogues.speaker: STRICKLAND
dialogues.text: Where is it? Where did you take it?

dialogues.speaker: ZELDA
dialogues.text: What are you talking about?

dialogues.speaker: STRICKLAND
dialogues.text: The thing in the lab. Where is it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I’m sorry, Mr. Strickland, if I knew anything I would surely tell you, but-—

dialogues.speaker: STRICKLAND
dialogues.text: Would you? Perhaps you would, if you knew exactly what was at stake. If you knew that all can be taken from you- if you were to - out of some misplaced loyalty to a traitorous friend - be untruthful. Brewster weighs his options. Half-watches TV. STRICKLAND (CONT’D) That story about Samson. I never told you how it ends... (beat) After the Philistines- torture him and blind him- Samson asks God for the strength he needs- and at the last minute- he is spared. For Samson is a good man and a man of principle and the Lord gives his strength back to him. One last time. And just then, Strickland grips the fingers-

dialogues.speaker: STRICKLAND, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: And he holds the columns of the temple with his powerful arms and crushes them- and he brings the whole building down on the Philistines. -and rips them loose!! Blood pours out. He grabs a gauze. Clamps his hand.

dialogues.speaker: STRICKLAND, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: He kills them all. He dies. But he gets every single one of them motherfuckers. That is his will. Pulls out his gun. STRICKLAND (CONT’D) That’s how powerful his will is. (beat) Now, do you know what that story means? For us, Delilah? (beat) (MORE)

dialogues.speaker: STRICKLAND, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: It means that if you know something you're not telling me, you will tell me. Either before or after I bring this particular temple down upon our heads. I am, for the time being, the true plight of the Negro, Zeldelilah... Brewster’s had enough.

dialogues.speaker: BREWSTER
dialogues.text: Gal done stole that thing right out the lab! Whatever it is! I hear them talking and talking and I have made my mind about it!! They both look over, a little stunned that he’s spoken.

dialogues.speaker: BREWSTER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Mute girl took it. She’s who you want to interminate. Zelda's eyes narrow.

dialogues.speaker: STRICKLAND
dialogues.text: (holding his spurting fingers) Thank you very much, Mr. Fuller for your assistance.

dialogues.speaker: BREWSTER
dialogues.text: Don’t say nothin’ of it.

dialogues.speaker: ZELDA
dialogues.text: What have you done- (beat) I have to warn her. He’s going after her-- Brewster gets between her and the phone.

dialogues.speaker: BREWSTER
dialogues.text: You will not do such a thing, Woman. I just saved your life. Why you worry about her? Bitch deserves to be gone after, she broke the law.  199 200 201 202 203 204 205 Zelda pushes him. Stares at him, hating him and all he is Dials quickly.

dialogues.speaker: ZELDA
dialogues.text: Shut up, Brewster! Shut up! For years- You don’t talk and now you can’t shut your mouth up. Damn you Brewster! You wouldn't understand. You couldn’t understand. Not if you tried your whole life- She loves him. (beat) She loves him On the phone now.

dialogues.speaker: ZELDA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Giles, that you? Put Elisa on. (then) Elisa, honey, you gotta listen to me, make a sound in the phone if you can hear... good. He’s coming for you. You got to go now and take that thing with you. Give the phone back to Giles... INT. ELISA’S APARTMENT - NIGHT Elisa hands Giles the phone.

dialogues.speaker: 209A
dialogues.text: 210 113 She Enters the apartment, walks to the tub and extends he hand towards the creature, helping it out of the tub.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Strickland is already pulling up. He takes the stairs—

dialogues.speaker: OMITTED 207
dialogues.text: EXT/INT. CORRIDOR/ELISA’S APARTMENT - NIGHT 208 Strickland finishes climbing the stairs - takes the corri and bashes open Elisa’s door. No one there. He looks around: Looks in the bathroom. Algae in the tub.

dialogues.speaker: STRICKLAND
dialogues.text: Dammit. He searches the table, picks up an egg. Checks the kitche spots the calendar and the note: RAIN and DOCKS. Strickland on the phone in the corridor. STRICKLAND (CONT’D) They're at the docks, Sally. Send back up and a containment unit. We will get them. He slams down the phone and goes out the fire escape door

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rain. Falling on them: Giles parks the van- takes a flashlight and goes around the van. He opens the door. El holds the Amphibian Man in her lap.

dialogues.speaker: GILES
dialogues.text: Come on. We have to go. Come on.  114 Elisa takes the creature to the edge of the water. The Amphibian Man looks at the waters- murky, dark and co and then looks back at Giles. Giles removes his hat and places the Amphibian Man’s hand his newly grown hair. The Amphibian Man takes Giles’ hand places it on his head. Giles smiles goodbye and walks awa with his flashlight. The Amphibian Man lets out a quiet, heart-breaking whimpe and moves towards her. She signs fast- “Go. Alone. Without me.” The creature stands in the rain- streaks of it running do his face and cheeks, like tears- so many tears. Slowly- deliberately, he signs back at her. Elisa cries openly. Moves to him. -towards the water. The creature looks at her. Hesitates. Caught between freedom and her. She turns her back. He looks at the murky waters. STRICKLAND has arrived- Giles turns. Strickland knocks him down in two moves. She turns to warn the creature- tries to scream- But she is mute- A painful hiss emerges from her throat- tries again. Fails. Strickland shoots twice. The Creature’s back explodes in cloud of blood. It falls. Distant sirens are heard now. Elisa steps between the creature and him- Strickland raises his revolver. Shoots a third time. Elisa turns. She feels a hole in her coat. Elisa discover almost casually- that she has taken a bullet in her chest She falls next to the Amphibian Man. She turns to the creature. Giles picks up a broken piece of wood from the floor. Hit Strickland. Strickland falls.  115 He Loses the cattle prod. Giles runs to Elisa, cradles her. Strickland slowly gets up. He empties the chambers and st reloading the gun. The creature- its bioluminescence markings ablaze- rises the ground, heads towards Strickland. Strickland is shocked- Now the chromatophores in the Amphibian Man’s body seem t glow and get brighter. The Amphibian Man pushes the gun away. Around his head: a shimmering halo of bioluminescence.

dialogues.speaker: STRICKLAND
dialogues.text: Fuck- you are a God. The Amphibian Man deploys one of his finger claws and swiftly, calmly- -he slices Strickland’s throat. Strickland falls down, bleeding. PATROL CARS arrive. The creature looks at Giles and then moves towards Elisa. embraces her tenderly: their eyes meet. STRICKLAND, on the ground, is dies Giles is with Elisa. The creature lifts Elisa from the gr with infinite tenderness. She caresses his face. He cares her. Policemen pour out of the cars. Zelda breaks through the group. Moves towards Giles... The creature stands on the edge of the pier, holding Elis He jumps into the water and disappears. The cops stand there looking at each other. Giles moves to the edge of the pier- looks down. Zelda co to his side- trembling. Tears streak her face, mixing wit the rain.

dialogues.speaker: ZELDA
dialogues.text: They're together, aren’t they?

dialogues.speaker: GILES
dialogues.text: Yes. I believe they are

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 211 116 They hold hands.

dialogues.speaker: GILES / NARRATOR
dialogues.text: If I told you about it- What would I Say? That they lived happily ever after? I believe they did... That. they were in love- that they remained in love? I’m sure that is true

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Elisa and the creature sink softly, gracefully. Fish dart Odd drifting objects... empty food’cans, an alarm clock.. The creature kisses her- a kiss so gentle- and covers her wound with his webbed palm.

dialogues.speaker: GILES / NARRATOR
dialogues.text: But when I think of her, of Elisa- all that comes to mind is a poem. Made of just a few truthful words... Whispered by someone in love, hundreds of years ago... (beat) “Unable to perceive the shape of You, I find You all around me. Your presence fills my eyes with Your love, It humbles my heart, For You are everywhere.” He then lets her body float away from him- -holding her but by the hand. Her head, crowned by a halo hair. She gasps! Drowning! Spasms! He holds her down! She grows still. And just as he releases her... the scars on the sides of Elisa’s neck open- Revealing gills. She opens her eyes and looks at him. Alive. He embraces h Blue and red lights illuminate them from above. Camera pulls back until they become small, blurry figures shifting in and out of focus from our field of vision... The Shape of Water.
